channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Physics-informed Deep Super-resolution for Spatiotemporal Data
item.description: High-fidelity simulation of complex physical systems is exorbitantly expensive and inaccessible across spatiotemporal scales.

item.title: CIPCaD-Bench: Continuous Industrial Process datasets for benchmarking Causal Discovery methods
item.description: This work introduces two novel public datasets for CD in continuous manufacturing processes.

item.title: Unified Normalization for Accelerating and Stabilizing Transformers
item.description: To tackle these issues, we propose Unified Normalization (UN), which can speed up the inference by being fused with other linear operations and achieve comparable performance on par with LN.

item.title: Late Fusion Multi-view Clustering via Global and Local Alignment Maximization
item.description: It optimally fuses multiple source information in partition level from each individual view, and maximally aligns the consensus partition with these weighted base ones.

item.title: Are Cluster Validity Measures (In)valid?
item.description: Internal cluster validity measures (such as the Calinski-Harabasz, Dunn, or Davies-Bouldin indices) are frequently used for selecting the appropriate number of partitions a dataset should be split into.

item.title: In-Hand Pose Estimation and Pin Inspection for Insertion of Through-Hole Components
item.description: A deep learning segmentation of the pins is performed and the inspection pose is found by simulation.

item.title: DSR -- A dual subspace re-projection network for surface anomaly detection
item.description: The state-of-the-art in discriminative unsupervised surface anomaly detection relies on external datasets for synthesizing anomaly-augmented training images.

item.title: Multiview Regenerative Morphing with Dual Flows
item.description: This paper aims to address a new task of image morphing under a multiview setting, which takes two sets of multiview images as the input and generates intermediate renderings that not only exhibit smooth transitions between the two input sets but also ensure visual consistency across different views at any transition state.

item.title: PyABSA: Open Framework for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Besides, previous efforts usually neglect the precursor aspect term extraction (ASC) subtask and focus on the aspect sentiment classification (ATE) subtask.

item.title: An Image is Worth One Word: Personalizing Text-to-Image Generation using Textual Inversion
item.description: Yet, it is unclear how such freedom can be exercised to generate images of specific unique concepts, modify their appearance, or compose them in new roles and novel scenes.

item.title: Detecting Individual Decision-Making Style: Exploring Behavioral Stylometry in Chess
item.description: We present a transformer-based approach to behavioral stylometry in the context of chess, where one attempts to identify the player who played a set of games.

item.title: Stochastic Deep Networks with Linear Competing Units for Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning
item.description: This work addresses meta-learning (ML) by considering deep networks with stochastic local winner-takes-all (LWTA) activations.

item.title: ferret: a Framework for Benchmarking Explainers on Transformers
item.description: Many interpretability tools allow practitioners and researchers to explain Natural Language Processing systems.

item.title: T4DT: Tensorizing Time for Learning Temporal 3D Visual Data
item.description: We show that low-rank tensor compression is extremely compact to store and query time-varying signed distance functions.

item.title: Performance Comparison of Deep RL Algorithms for Energy Systems Optimal Scheduling
item.description: This trade-off introduces extra hyperparameters that impact the DRL algorithms' performance and capability of providing feasible solutions.

item.title: What Can Transformers Learn In-Context? A Case Study of Simple Function Classes
item.description: To make progress towards understanding in-context learning, we consider the well-defined problem of training a model to in-context learn a function class (e. g., linear functions): that is, given data derived from some functions in the class, can we train a model to in-context learn "most" functions from this class?

item.title: XOOD: Extreme Value Based Out-Of-Distribution Detection For Image Classification
item.description: Detecting out-of-distribution (OOD) data at inference time is crucial for many applications of machine learning.

item.title: TransDeepLab: Convolution-Free Transformer-based DeepLab v3+ for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Especially, deep neural networks based on seminal architectures such as U-shaped models with skip-connections or atrous convolution with pyramid pooling have been tailored to a wide range of medical image analysis tasks.

item.title: Understanding Adversarial Robustness of Vision Transformers via Cauchy Problem
item.description: Recent research on the robustness of deep learning has shown that Vision Transformers (ViTs) surpass the Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) under some perturbations, e. g., natural corruption, adversarial attacks, etc.

item.title: Attacking Adversarial Defences by Smoothing the Loss Landscape
item.description: This paper investigates a family of methods for defending against adversarial attacks that owe part of their success to creating a noisy, discontinuous, or otherwise rugged loss landscape that adversaries find difficult to navigate.

item.title: Cross Attention Based Style Distribution for Controllable Person Image Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we propose a cross attention based style distribution module that computes between the source semantic styles and target pose for pose transfer.

item.title: CBAG: An Efficient Genetic Algorithm for the Graph Burning Problem
item.description: Graph burning is a simplified deterministic model for how information spreads within networks.

item.title: DoF-NeRF: Depth-of-Field Meets Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: To mitigate this issue, we introduce DoF-NeRF, a novel neural rendering approach that can deal with shallow DoF inputs and can simulate DoF effect.

item.title: Software Package for Automated Analysis of Lung Ultrasound Videos
item.description: In the recent past with the rapid surge of COVID-19 infections, lung ultrasound has emerged as a fast and powerful diagnostic tool particularly for continuous and periodic monitoring of the lung.

item.title: Predicting Future Mosquito Habitats Using Time Series Climate Forecasting and Deep Learning
item.description: Mosquito habitat ranges are projected to expand due to climate change.

item.title: Weighted Scaling Approach for Metabolomics Data Analysis
item.description: We evaluated the performance of the proposed method in comparison to the other existing conventional scaling techniques using metabolomics data analysis in both the absence and presence of different percentages of outliers.

item.title: Multi-Document Summarization with Centroid-Based Pretraining
item.description: In multi-document summarization (MDS), the input is a cluster of documents, and the output is the cluster summary.

item.title: FrOoDo: Framework for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: FrOoDo is an easy-to-use and flexible framework for Out-of-Distribution detection tasks in digital pathology.

item.title: Large-Scale Product Retrieval with Weakly Supervised Representation Learning
item.description: Large-scale weakly supervised product retrieval is a practically useful yet computationally challenging problem.

item.title: What do Deep Neural Networks Learn in Medical Images?
item.description: Deep learning is increasingly gaining rapid adoption in healthcare to help improve patient outcomes.

item.title: Joint covariate-alignment and concept-alignment: a framework for domain generalization
item.description: Particularly, our framework proposes to jointly minimize both the covariate-shift as well as the concept-shift between the seen domains for a better performance on the unseen domain.

item.title: Improving Fine-Grained Visual Recognition in Low Data Regimes via Self-Boosting Attention Mechanism
item.description: In low data regimes, a network often struggles to choose the correct regions for recognition and tends to overfit spurious correlated patterns from the training data.

item.title: Accurate Polygonal Mapping of Buildings in Satellite Imagery
item.description: We addressed such an issue by exploiting the hierarchical supervision (of bottom-level vertices, mid-level line segments and the high-level regional masks) and proposed a novel interaction mechanism of feature embedding sourced from different levels of supervision signals to obtain reversible building masks for polygonal mapping of buildings.

item.title: Local Perception-Aware Transformer for Aerial Tracking
item.description: Specifically, with local-modeling to global-search mechanism, the proposed tracker replaces the global encoder by a novel local-recognition encoder.

item.title: DSLA: Dynamic smooth label assignment for efficient anchor-free object detection
item.description: The dynamic smooth label is assigned to supervise the classification branch.

item.title: CLIFF: Carrying Location Information in Full Frames into Human Pose and Shape Estimation
item.description: Top-down methods dominate the field of 3D human pose and shape estimation, because they are decoupled from human detection and allow researchers to focus on the core problem.

item.title: Stochastic failure of cell infection post viral entry: Implications for infection outcomes and antiviral therapy
item.description: We show that infections wherein virus is release by an infected cell as a single burst, rather than at a constant rate over the cell's infectious lifespan, has the same probability of infection extinction, despite previous claims to this effect [Pearson 2011, doi:10. 1371/journal. pcbi. 1001058].

item.title: Data Collection and Analysis of French Dialects
item.description: This paper discusses creating and analysing a new dataset for data mining and text analytics research, contributing to a joint Leeds University research project for the Corpus of National Dialects.

item.title: Towards Computing an Optimal Abstraction for Structural Causal Models
item.description: Working with causal models at different levels of abstraction is an important feature of science.

item.title: Learning to Grasp on the Moon from 3D Octree Observations with Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Domain randomization improves the generalization of learned policies to novel scenes with previously unseen objects and different illumination conditions.

item.title: Few-shot Adaptation Works with UnpredicTable Data
item.description: Finetuning on the resulting dataset leads to improved FSL performance on Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks, but not proportionally to dataset scale.

item.title: Automatically Discovering Novel Visual Categories with Self-supervised Prototype Learning
item.description: In the first stage, we obtain a robust feature extractor, which could serve for all images with base and novel categories.

item.title: Improving the Trainability of Deep Neural Networks through Layerwise Batch-Entropy Regularization
item.description: We show empirically that we can therefore train a "vanilla" fully connected network and convolutional neural network -- no skip connections, batch normalization, dropout, or any other architectural tweak -- with 500 layers by simply adding the batch-entropy regularization term to the loss function.

item.title: Off-Policy Correction for Actor-Critic Algorithms in Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Although the well-studied importance sampling and off-policy policy gradient techniques were proposed to compensate for this discrepancy, they usually require a collection of long trajectories that increases the computational complexity and induce additional problems such as vanishing or exploding gradients.

item.title: COCOA: Cross Modality Contrastive Learning for Sensor Data
item.description: Contrastive Learning (CL) is one of the most well-known approaches in SSL that attempts to learn general, informative representations of data.

item.title: Robotic Dough Shaping
item.description: We address the problem of shaping a piece of dough-like deformable material into a 2D target shape presented upfront.

item.title: Aggretriever: A Simple Approach to Aggregate Textual Representation for Robust Dense Passage Retrieval
item.description: Our work demonstrates that MLM pre-trained transformers can be used to effectively encode text information into a single-vector for dense retrieval.

item.title: eco2AI: carbon emissions tracking of machine learning models as the first step towards sustainable AI
item.description: The size and complexity of deep neural networks continue to grow exponentially, significantly increasing energy consumption for training and inference by these models.

item.title: INSightR-Net: Interpretable Neural Network for Regression using Similarity-based Comparisons to Prototypical Examples
item.description: Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) have shown exceptional performance for a range of medical imaging tasks.

item.title: Adaptive Edge Offloading for Image Classification Under Rate Limit
item.description: Because of limited computing capacity, embedded devices rely on a parsimonious classification model with uneven accuracy.
